vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `coreutils` package. chroot in GNU coreutils, when used with --userspec, allows local users to escape to the parent session via a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal's input buffer. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:21.04` `coreutils`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-2781) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/02/28/2) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/02/28/3) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2016-2781)
vulnerabilities.name: coreutils

vulnerabilities.title: Reachable Assertion
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.30 to 2.32, when converting UCS4 text containing an irreversible character, fails an assertion in the code path and aborts the program, potentially resulting in a denial of service. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:21.04` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-29562) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210122-0004/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/TVCUNLQ3HXGS4VPUQKWTJGRAW2KTFGXS/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26923) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in IBM1364, IBM1371, IBM1388, IBM1390, and IBM1399 encodings, fails to advance the input state, which could lead to an infinite loop in applications, resulting in a denial of service, a different vulnerability from CVE-2016-10228. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:21.04` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-27618) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210401-0006/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519#c21) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26224)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv program in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.31 and earlier, when invoked with multiple suffixes in the destination encoding (TRANSLATE or IGNORE) along with the -c option, enters an infinite loop when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences, leading to a denial of service. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:21.04` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519#c21) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26224) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-10228) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [OSS security Advisory](http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/03/01/10) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96525) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2016-10228)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Certificate Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `gnupg2` package. Interaction between the sks-keyserver code through 1.2.0 of the SKS keyserver network, and GnuPG through 2.2.16, makes it risky to have a GnuPG keyserver configuration line referring to a host on the SKS keyserver network. Retrieving data from this network may cause a persistent denial of service, because of a Certificate Spamming Attack. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:21.04` `gnupg2`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://lists.gnupg.org/pipermail/gnupg-announce/2019q3/000439.html) - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K08654551) - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K08654551?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/AUK2YRO6QIH64WP2LRA5D4LACTXQPPU4/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/CP4ON34YEXEZDZOXXWV43KVGGO6WZLJ5/) - [MISC](https://gist.github.com/rjhansen/67ab921ffb4084c865b3618d6955275f) - [MISC](https://twitter.com/lambdafu/status/1147162583969009664) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-08/msg00039.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-13050)

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-33560
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgcrypt20` package. Libgcrypt before 1.8.8 and 1.9.x before 1.9.3 mishandles ElGamal encryption because it lacks exponent blinding to address a side-channel attack against mpi_powm, and the window size is not chosen appropriately. (There is also an interoperability problem because the selection of the k integer value does not properly consider the differences between basic ElGamal encryption and generalized ElGamal encryption.) This, for example, affects use of ElGamal in OpenPGP. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:21.04` `libgcrypt20`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-33560) - [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/rCe8b7f10be275bcedb5fc05ed4837a89bfd605c61) - [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/T5305) - [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/T5328) - [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/T5466)
vulnerabilities.name: libgcrypt20

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Management Errors
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libtasn1-6` package. GNU Libtasn1-4.13 libtasn1-4.13 version libtasn1-4.13, libtasn1-4.12 contains a DoS, specifically CPU usage will reach 100% when running asn1Paser against the POC due to an issue in _asn1_expand_object_id(p_tree), after a long time, the program will be killed. This attack appears to be exploitable via parsing a crafted file. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:21.04` `libtasn1-6`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://gitlab.com/gnutls/libtasn1/issues/4) - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1000654) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-1000654) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-06/msg00009.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-06/msg00018.html) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/105151) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-1000654)
vulnerabilities.name: libtasn1-6

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-3520
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `lz4` package. See `Remediation` section below for `Ubuntu:21.04` relevant versions. There's a flaw in lz4. An attacker who submits a crafted file to an application linked with lz4 may be able to trigger an integer overflow, leading to calling of memmove() on a negative size argument, causing an out-of-bounds write and/or a crash. The greatest impact of this flaw is to availability, with some potential impact to confidentiality and integrity as well. ## Remediation Upgrade `Ubuntu:21.04` `lz4` to version 1.9.3-1ubuntu0.1 or higher. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3520) - [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1954559)
vulnerabilities.name: lz4/liblz4-1

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `pcre3` package. libpcre in PCRE before 8.43 allows a subject buffer over-read in JIT when UTF is disabled, and \X or \R has more than one fixed quantifier, a related issue to CVE-2019-20454. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:21.04` `pcre3`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-20838) - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-20838) - [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT211931) - [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT212147) - [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2020/Dec/32) - [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/Feb/14) - [MISC](https://bugs.gentoo.org/717920) - [MISC](https://www.pcre.org/original/changelog.txt) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)
vulnerabilities.name: pcre3/libpcre3

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `pcre3` package. In PCRE 8.41, the OP_KETRMAX feature in the match function in pcre_exec.c allows stack exhaustion (uncontrolled recursion) when processing a crafted regular expression. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:21.04` `pcre3`. ## References - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-11164) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-11164) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [OSS security Advisory](http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/07/11/3) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99575) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-11164)
vulnerabilities.name: pcre3/libpcre3

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd 242 changes the VT1 mode upon a logout, which allows attackers to read cleartext passwords in certain circumstances, such as watching a shutdown, or using Ctrl-Alt-F1 and Ctrl-Alt-F2. This occurs because the KDGKBMODE (aka current keyboard mode) check is mishandled. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:21.04` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20839) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/9725f1a10f80f5e0ae7d9b60547458622aeb322f) - [GitHub PR](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/pull/12378) - [MISC](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/systemd/+bug/1803993) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190530-0002/) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108389) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20839)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Authentication Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. An exploitable denial-of-service vulnerability exists in Systemd 245. A specially crafted DHCP FORCERENEW packet can cause a server running the DHCP client to be vulnerable to a DHCP ACK spoofing attack. An attacker can forge a pair of FORCERENEW and DCHP ACK packets to reconfigure the server. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:21.04` `systemd`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-13529) - [MISC](https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1142)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd 242 changes the VT1 mode upon a logout, which allows attackers to read cleartext passwords in certain circumstances, such as watching a shutdown, or using Ctrl-Alt-F1 and Ctrl-Alt-F2. This occurs because the KDGKBMODE (aka current keyboard mode) check is mishandled. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:21.04` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20839) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/9725f1a10f80f5e0ae7d9b60547458622aeb322f) - [GitHub PR](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/pull/12378) - [MISC](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/systemd/+bug/1803993) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190530-0002/) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108389) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20839)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Authentication Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. An exploitable denial-of-service vulnerability exists in Systemd 245. A specially crafted DHCP FORCERENEW packet can cause a server running the DHCP client to be vulnerable to a DHCP ACK spoofing attack. An attacker can forge a pair of FORCERENEW and DCHP ACK packets to reconfigure the server. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:21.04` `systemd`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-13529) - [MISC](https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1142)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `tar` package. pax_decode_header in sparse.c in GNU Tar before 1.32 had a NULL pointer dereference when parsing certain archives that have malformed extended headers. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:21.04` `tar`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-9923) - [MISC](http://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/tar.git/commit/?id=cb07844454d8cc9fb21f53ace75975f91185a120) - [MISC](http://savannah.gnu.org/bugs/?55369) - [MISC](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/tar/+bug/1810241) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-04/msg00077.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-9923)
vulnerabilities.name: tar
